New Records: Nedim Bajrami set a new record for the fastest goal scored in European Championship history when opening the scoring against Italy
Key Match Events: Qazim Laci nodded in a superb cross from Jasir Asani in the 11th minute
Albania's defensive midfielder Klaus Gjasula scored an own goal in the 76th minute
Ante Budimir teed up Andrej Kramaric for their equaliser in the 74th minute
Budimir and Kramaric teamed up for another goal two minutes later
Albania's Mitaj pulled back a wonderful low cross for Gjasula to score an equalising goal in the 94th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Croatia’s Luka Modric had warned that Group B was “the most difficult in the tournament”
Post-Match Reflections: Sylvinho and his staff were seen celebrating Albania’s draw
Sylvinho said 'We have to fight for every point, for our country and for our federation'
Asllani said 'This is Albania; it’s a bit crazy'
Sylvinho's scrappers will need to be at their very best to get a result against Spain in their final group game
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was an unexpected and entertaining romp
Croatia had 69 per cent possession at half-time, but Albania had the game’s better chances
Albania's hard work eventually paid off deep in stoppage time
Gjasula — only the second player to score an own goal and a goal within the same game at the Euros — had given his side a slender chance of making it to the round of 16
Others: Injuries to Manaj and Armando Broja throughout the qualifying games meant neither striker built the sort of playing chemistry a team needs to be a potent counter-attacking side
